document.docTitle: Carvalhoma weiri Namyatova & Cassis 2016, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the staphylinoid and ground-dwelling genus Carvalhoma Slater & Gross (Insecta: Heteroptera: Miridae: Cylapinae) of Australia

Fig. 7. Genitalia of
C. malcolmae Slater & Gross, 1977
. A . Aedeagus, left lateral view. B . Aedeagus, ventral view. C . Genital capsule. D . Right paramere. E . Left paramere. F . Dorsal labiate plate of bursa copulatrix. G . Posterior wall of bursa copulatrix. Scale bars = 0.1 mm (the large scale bar is for A–B and D–E, the small scale bar is for C and F–G).

subSubSection.paragraph: The species is named after T. Weir, one of the collectors of the specimens.

materialsCitation.collectorName: T. Weir & J. F. Lawrence & M. L. Johnson

subSubSection.paragraph: AUSTRALIA : Australian Capital Territory : 1 Ƌ, same collection data as holotype (00043339) ( ANIC ); 1 ♀ , Wombat Creek, 6 km NE of Piccadilly Circus, 35.19° S , 148.51° E , 750 m , Jan. 1984 , T. Weir, J.F. Lawrence and M.L. Johnson leg. (00043344) ( ANIC ).

Fig. 9. Genitalia of
C. parvum
sp. nov. A . Aedeagus, left lateral view. B . Aedeagus, ventral view. C . Genital capsule. D . Right paramere. E . Left paramere. F . Dorsal labiate plate of bursa copulatrix. G . Posterior wall of bursa copulatrix. Scale bars = 0.1 mm (the large scale bar is for A–B and D–E, the small scale bar is for C and F–G).

Fig. 10. Genitalia of
C. weiri
sp. nov. A . Aedeagus, left lateral view. B .Aedeagus, ventral view. C . Genital capsule. D . Right paramere. E . Left paramere. F . Dorsal labiate plate of bursa copulatrix. G . Posterior wall of bursa copulatrix. Scale bars = 0.1 mm (the large scale bar is for A–B and D–E, the small scale bar is for C and F–G).

subSubSection.paragraph: GENITALIA ( Fig. 10 A–E). Right paramere without ridge dorsally, its outer margin concave; apices of parameres straight, not hook-shaped; left paramere with ridge dorsally, its basal swelling rounded. Theca mostly membranous; endosoma with single sclerite, placed ventrally on the right side.
SURFACE AND VESTITURE. Similar to male, but setae on dorsum and legs distinct.

STRUCTURE AND MEASUREMENTS. Body ca 5.0–5.1× longer than pronotum width; head ca 2.3× wider than long, vertex ca 0.9× wider than eye diameter; head ca 1.2× wider than high; antennal segment I ca 2.1× longer than vertex width, segment II ca 4.9× longer than vertex width, and ca 2.3× longer than segment I; pronotum ca 1.1× wider than long, ca 0.8× wider than head; hind femur ca 2.5× longer than head height.
Known only from the Australian Capital Territory ( Fig. 11 ).

Antennal segments III and IV are broken in the males of the type material, and segments II–IV are broken in the female. In contrast to other
Carvalhoma
species, specimens of
C. weiri
sp. nov. are relatively pale, and genitalia also very soft and pale, which can indicate that the specimens are teneral.

Carvalhoma weiri
sp. nov. is most similar to
C. malcolmae
in the relatively large size, elongate body, surface and vestiture ( Fig. 1 ). However,
C. malcolmae
differs in the mostly dark brown to black male ( Fig. 1 ), the frons distinctly protruding anteriad of the eyes ( Figs 1 , 2B ), in dorsal view ca 2.1× as wide as long in male and 1.7–2.2× in female.
